reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Responding COVID-19 Pandemic and GBV through greater public awareness and assisting women and girls at risks in Kabul, Nangarhar, Farah, Paktia and Logar Provinces of Afghanistan.

description.narrative:
The project intends to reach vulnerable communities with timely response to protection needs of IDPs, returnees and host communities with provision of dignity kits to women and girls’ survivors with timely fashion and GBV awareness raising in the light of COVID-19 response through local radio and TV as well as social media in Kabul, Nangarhar, Farah, Paktia and Logar province. During the project implementation period, total of 288 community awareness and mobilization sessions will be organized in 12 targeted districts, in each district 24 sessions will be conducted, and each session will have 10 persons, and each session will have duration of two to three hours. The community mobilization component of the project will target men, boys, community and religious leaders with aim to prevent and respond to GBV.
To ensure the project activities are not duplicated in the area, AABRAR will implement this project in the following villages: Paktia:
Ahmadaba: Patan Khil , Kooz Noria Khil, Sardar Khill, Sara Qala, Sangi khel. Gardez: Akbar abad, Belal khel, Khani Qala, Dali Khil, Pathullah Khil Mehlan. Sayed Karam: Nan Khil, Raza Khil, Dagary Jalat, Madak, Shanak Farah: Anardara: Namarat Kalata, Kalata Alam Khan, Kariz Aqa Banan, Dahan shar, Abdul Hamid khan. Balabuluk: Rashar Abad, Rebat Barzo, Masjed Allah Dad, Ahsamdin, Haji Abdul Ghani. Nangarhar: Behsud: Pole Saracha, Qala Arbab, Loy Khosh Gunbad, Joidah Dreyema Wyalah, Gawmish Bila Kama: Qala-e-Akhond, Muslim Abad, Bila yari, Bocha Qala, Sher Gar Gul Mohamad. Kuzkunar: Poori Kali, Dagyan Daman, Gandaro, Bar Yaseen Kali, Now Jo. Logar: Charkh: Zarsang, Qala-e-Naw Bala, Masjidi Mula Halim, Masjidi Naw Shahr, shash Qala-e-Payan. Mohammadagha: Baba Aslam, Hassan khil, Loy Kalai Dashtak, Humza and Syed kamal, Doroo Surkh Ab. Pul-e-Alam: Khawaja Mohammad Akber, Qala-e- Ezat amp Ainullah, Shamshirkhill, Qala-e Niazi, Nawi Kala Kabul: Qarabagh: Nahr-e-Bala, Qarya Bala Joy, Qala Dewana, Kaka Khil Gala Wan, Dinar Khail, Qarabagh Bazar. Moreover, our other awareness activity will include live radio round-table sessions – to talk about on specific GBV topics to increase the knowledge of audiences and to improve the behavior communication aspects of COVID-19. Total of 50 radio round-table sessions will be organized, each session will have 4 panelists who will provide information on preventing and responding to violence against women and other GBV issues and dealing with the current pandemic in targeted areas. Each round-table session shall have duration of 45 minutes, 30 minutes for discussion and 15 minutes for responding to the live calls from callers – also, AABRAR will organize one live television round-table sessions comparing of 4 panelists, three female and one male who will discuss on specific women matters identified in the specific province as well as addressing the COVID-19 outbreak, precautionary measures. Our third awareness activity shall include awareness through printing visualized materials including pictorial Posters message and Pamphlets, AABRAR will distribute Dignity Kits in our 12 targeted districts. As per our plan, AABRAR will distribute total of 3180 dignity kits (265 in each targeted district) through our district level teams and support of local communities. The dignity kits will include all essential items including hand sanitizer, anti-bacterial soap, shampoo, towel, Dettol soap, soap case, laundry soap, Baby-safe antibacterial wipes, mobile phone credit for accessing hotlines chamberpots, Nail clipper, Vaseline, Comb, Hair brush, Scarf, Tooth paste, Tooth brush, Solar torch, Torch and Sanitary pad. In order to properly increase awareness on GBV risk, AABRAR PSS counseling and GBV case management and referral services will be provided through women friendly spaces to specialized facility based services. The project team will continue follow up of referral cases and psychosocial service through door-to-door approach till end of the project
